char Decipher::max_char ( int  alpha[26]  ) 

Parameters:
alpha is the array that we are searching for the max
Returns:
the most frequently occuring character in the array it will just return 'a' if there is no alphabetical character in the text

char Decipher::max_frequency ( const char *  b,
const char *  e 
)

O(1) in space O(n) in time

Parameters:
b a pointer to the beginning of a cstring (inclusive)
e a pointer to the end of a cstring (exclusive) (b < e)
Returns:
the character that occurs the most often in [b, e), in lower case it is guaranteed that only ONE character will occur the most often ignore non-alphabetic characters (numbers, punctuation, whitespace, etc.) case IS NOT significant ('a' IS the same as 'A')

void Decipher::rotate ( char *  b,
char *  e,
int  r 
)

O(1) in space O(n) in time

Parameters:
b a pointer to the beginning of a cstring (inclusive)
e a pointer to the end of a cstring (exclusive) (b < e)
r the amount to rotate to the right rotate the alphabetic characters of [b, e) through the alphabet by rotation 'r' ignore non-alphabetic characters (numbers, punctuation, whitespace, etc.) case IS significant ('a' IS NOT the same as 'A')
